text: Danièle Graule (1 October 1944 – 18 July 2022), known as Dani, was a French actress, model and pop singer. She was born in Castres, France. Her career began in 1966. She was known for her movie roles in Day for Night (1973), Les Anneaux de Bicêtre (1976), Love on the Run (1979), Story of Women (1988), Avenue Montaigne (2006) and Guy (2018). Dani was meant to have been France's Eurovision 1974 entry with the song "La Vie à 25 ans", but President Georges Pompidou died in the week of the competition, so she never formally competed at Eurovision. Dani died on 18 July 2022 at her home in Tours, France from a heart attack, aged 77.La chanteuse castraise Dani est morte à l'âge de 77 ans ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:French models Category:French movie actors Category:French pop singers Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants Category:People from Tarn
title: Dani (singer)
